result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher John Littlewolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 bond on file applied to the costs.  Balance added to the payment plan in 15CT28.    Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 15CT28

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher John Littlewolf

records.addlTxt: Order to Modify Funds Due - Deceased June 4, 2018

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Request.  Must post 25% ($500.00) of fines before released.  Granted $50.00/month beginning 11-15-16.
FIDR destroyed

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1 as charged.  Victim notification complied with.  DRI Count 2.  Court advised the charge and possible penalties defendant plead to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for plea.  Find guilty of count 1 as charged.  State recommended 60-90 days consecutive to 15CT28.  Attorney Artis requests concurrent sentences.  Court ordered:  90 days jail, consecutive to 15CT28.  Credit for 17 days.  CC added to payment plan in 15CT28.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Apply bond to CC.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-17-2015 10:30 am
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  Attorney Artis wishes to delay plea/sentencing to 8/17/15.
Status conference at 07-13-2015 03:00 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  Victim notification requirements met.  Plea/sentencing not held.  STC set for 7/13/15 at 3 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-06-2015 10:30 am
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Artis.  The parties have come to an agreement.  Plea/sentencing set for 7/6/15 at 10:30 am.

Status conference at 06-01-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-13-2015 10:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  Reading of complaint waived.  NGP entered by court.  PTC & STC dates set.  Bond continued.  Civil citation to track.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located with the exception of employment purposes only.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Cecelia B.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant by video from Jackson County Jail with no counsel present in courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant states he is filling out the petition for counsel now. Court instructs him to get it filed by today and set for adjourned initial appeare on 4-20-15 at 9:30.    Defendant requests a bond reduction.  Court lowers cash bond amount and sets conditions.
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-20-2015 09:30 am.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Court advised defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant said he understood. Defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.  Court told defendant to fill out petition for appointment of cournsel as soon as possible.  AIA set for 4/13/15.  Bond ordered continued.
WSPD eligibility form.  Defendant is not eligible for SPD representation

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail, without counsel.  Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Court advised defendant to contact SPD for representation, along with other attorney options.   Case bond sent.  AIA set for 4/6/15 at 9:30 am
